page.title: 09Religion in Cowlinge
page.content: The majority of residents of Cowlinge and Little Bradley belong to the Church of England. Two Roman Catholic families travel to a neighbouring village to attend church. The methodist chapels had large congregations in 1850 when the built but they are now closed due to decreasing attendances. One has been converted into a house the other into a warehouse. Cowlinge church is of Saxon origins. The rector sreves three parishes without a curate and is dependant on lay-readers to help with services. Religion does not play a major part in many peoples lives but the chrch is well attended for the celebration of Christmas, Easter etc. The tiny Saxon church at Little Bradley has one service each Sunday which is well attended.
